content: buffalo plaid toque created by lisa overby buffalo plaid a true canadian look brim of hat is knit long enough to double it up and the stranded colourwork adds an extra layer for a truly cozy winter toque knit using 4 colours of dk yarn pattern includes 3 sizes of toque for every member of the family ©2020 yarn twisters 1 buffalo plaid toque materials & info yarn 4 skeins estelle double knit 250m 273 abbreviations yards /100 g 50% acrylic 40% wool 10% nylon cdd - slip 2 stitches as if to k2tog knit 1 pass 2 slipped colour 1 c1 silver heather q65580 stitches together over the knit stitch 2 stitches de- colour 2 c2 black q65505 creased colour 3 c3 merlot q65506 co - cast on colour 4 c4 cardinal q65507 k - knit gauge 30 sts by 27 row equal 4 by 4 in 2 x 2 rib k2tog - knit 2 together insert needle into the next 2 with smaller needles after blocking sts knit the 2 sts together as one 1 st decreased needles 3 5 mm us 4 16 circular needles 4 5 mm p - purl us 7 16 circular needles 4 5 mm us 7 double round - round pointed needles or size needed to obtain gauge st/sts - stitch/stitches notions stitch markers darning needle finished sizes measurements taken unstretched baby/toddler 9 5 tall 13 circumference youth/ ladies small 10 75 tall 14 circumference ladies large/men 13 tall 16 circumference note 4 skeins of estelle double knit is enough to make 4 toques total 1 men s 2 youth and 1 toddler pattern instructions with smaller needles and c1 co 80 100 120 sts join baby/toddler finishing and decreases to knit in the round careful to not twist your sts place round 1 *with c2 k5 with c3 k5* repeat to end of round marker to denote the beginning of the round round 2 *with c2 k1 cdd k1 with c3 k1 cdd k1* re- ribbing all sizes peat until end of round 48 sts k2 p2 rib for approximately 3 3 5 4 5 inches switch round 3 *with c2 k3 with c3 k3* repeat to end of round to larger needles knit 1 round cut c1 round 4 *with c2 cdd with c3 cdd* repeat until end main body charted instructions on page 3 of round 16 sts cut c2 round 1 *with c2 k5 with c3 k5* repeat to end of round round 5 with c3 k2tog to end of round 8 sts rnds 2 to 5 repeat round 1 cut c2 cut c3 leaving a 6 tail weave through remaining sts round 6 *with c3 k5 with c4 k5* repeat to end of round weave in ends block toque rnds 7 to 10 repeat round 6 cut c4 for all sizes repeat rnds 1 to 10 two more times proceed to fin- ishing and decreases for the appropriate size ©2020 yarn twisters 2 buffalo plaid toque pattern
